A: 1. If a dance motif has 3 movements, and another has 4 movements, how many movements are there in total if they are combined (a) 6 (b) 7 (c) 8
2. Dance is a sequence of rhythmic steps or movements usually performed to match the style and speed of _ (a) light (b) music (c) silence
3. Which of these is an example of a dance type (a) Ballet (b) Painting (c) Sculpture
4. Ballet dance originated in Italian Renaissance courts in the _ century (a) 14th (b) 15th (c) 16th
5. Ballet later developed into a concert dance from France and _ (a) Italy (b) Germany (c) Russia
6. Ballroom dance involves _ dancing in a coordinated manner (a) individuals (b) partners (c) groups
7. Ballroom dance is very popular in _ America (a) South (b) North (c) Central
8. A ballet dance originated in the 15th century. How many centuries ago was that from the 21st century (a) 5 (b) 6 (c) 7
9. A dance motif is a piece of style of movement that can vary in _ (a) color (b) length (c) sound
10. A dance motif is _ during the whole performance (a) changed (b) repeated (c) ignored
11. A dance motif comprises _ or four movements joined together (a) two (b) three (c) five
12. A motif can be created to symbolize the movement of a _ or a cat (a) bird (b) fish (c) monkey
13. A good dance step requires knowledge and expertise in dance _ (a) costumes (b) motifs (c) stages
14. The mood of a motif is often determined by the dancer's feeling and the tone of the _ (a) lights (b) music (c) audience
15. If a dancer practices for 2 hours each day, how many hours does the dancer practice in 3 days (a) 4 (b) 5 (c) 6
16. A dance presented in honor of a departed soul is often performed _ (a) solo (b) with partners (c) in a group
17. The Unity dance is a Nigerian dance by King Sunny _ (a) Ade (b) Onwewu (c) Onyeka
18. The Alarioko dance expresses sorrow and _ (a) joy (b) sadness (c) excitement
19. One importance of motifs is that it serves as a _ for the dance (a) costume (b) framework (c) prop
20. Motifs help in dance _ (a) development (b) destruction (c) confusion
21. To apply a motif, one can change the level or _ of a movement (a) speed (b) direction (c) sound
22. A dance group has 5 members. If 2 members are absent, how many members are present (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 4
23. Reversing an action means stretching the hand backward instead of _ (a) sideways (b) downward (c) upward
24. A movement could be repeated in the _ instead of on the floor (a) water (b) air (c) ground
25. One can use other parts of the _ to apply a motif (a) stage (b) body (c) music
26. Increasing or decreasing the _ makes a motif faster or slower (a) tempo (b) volume (c) light
27. Fragmenting a motif means using only _ part repeatedly (a) every (b) one (c) no
28. Which of these is a vital component of dance (a) Flexibility (b) Painting (c) Singing
29. A dance performance has 10 components. If 3 are flexibility, balance, and coordination, how many other components are there (a) 6 (b) 7 (c) 8
30. The ability to turn, bend, or twist without breaking is called _ (a) balance (b) flexibility (c) stamina
31. The ability to remain physically and mentally calm for a dance is _ (a) coordination (b) balance (c) agility
32. Directing one's thoughts and physical movements effectively is _ (a) stamina (b) coordination (c) timing
33. Energy and strength to dance continually for a long period is _ (a) muscular strength (b) stamina (c) speed
34. Having the muscular muscles for the vigor of a dance is muscular _ (a) endurance (b) strength (c) agility
35. Being able to remain strong for the duration of a dance is muscular _ (a) strength (b) endurance (c) flexibility
36. If a dancer performs 6 times a week, how many performances are there in 2 weeks (a) 10 (b) 11 (c) 12
37. The quick movement of the limbs easily is _ (a) timing (b) agility (c) speed
38. Maintaining the pace of a dance to harmonize the rhythms of the music is _ (a) space (b) action (c) timing
39. Quick movement action in dance is called _ (a) speed (b) expression (c) costume
40. The space available for a dance is simply called _ (a) stage (b) space (c) area
41. The deliberate attempt to force the body to move in relation to the rhythm is _ (a) action (b) expression (c) makeup
42. Using the face to convey the message of a dance to the audience is _ (a) costume (b) expression (c) music
43. A dance studio has 8 rooms. If 3 rooms are used for ballet, how many rooms are left for other dances (a) 4 (b) 5 (c) 6
44. Using appropriate clothes for a dance is called _ (a) makeup (b) costume (c) music
45. Cosmetics and colorants applied to the skin to improve appearance is _ (a) costume (b) makeup (c) music
46. The sounds needed for a dance are referred to as _ (a) costume (b) makeup (c) music
47. A tensed up dancer can never dance _ (a) well (b) fast (c) slow
48. A dancer should have a pleasant facial _ (a) expression (b) costume (c) makeup
49. A dancer should _ the music he/she is dancing to (a) ignore (b) feel (c) dislike
50. A dancer should avoid being over _ during dance (a) confident (b) nervous (c) relaxed
B: 1. What is the primary purpose of any dance _________
2. In which century did acting become a real profession _________
3. Who is referred to as the founding father of the western tradition of acting _________
4. What is a female actor known as _________
5. Which Nigerian actor is mentioned in the text _________
C: 1. List two examples of dance types mentioned in the text.
2. State two things that determine the mood of a dance motif.
3. Mention two ways a dance motif can be applied to make a dance more interesting.
4. Name two components vital for performing dance.
5. Identify two basic skills a dancer needs to be knowledgeable about for effective communication through dance.
answers_C: Ballet and ballroom dance are two examples.
The dancer's feeling and the tone of the music determine the mood.
One can change the level or direction of a movement, or add or remove an action.
Flexibility and balance are two vital components.
A dancer needs to be relaxed and have a pleasant facial expression.
